detaileddescription.para: Set by getTransformation(long, STransformation) when the animation ends.
Set by getTransformation(long, STransformation) when the animation starts.
Set by getTransformation(long, STransformation) when the animation repeats in REVERSE mode.
The time in milliseconds at which the animation must start;
The delay in milliseconds after which the animation must start. When the start offset is > 0, the start time of the animation is startTime + startOffset.
The duration of one animation cycle in milliseconds.
The number of times the animation must repeat. By default, an animation repeats indefinitely.
Indicates how many times the animation was repeated.
The behavior of the animation when it repeats. The repeat mode is either RESTART or REVERSE.
The interpolator used by the animation to smooth the movement.
The animation listener to be notified when the animation starts, ends or repeats.
Desired Z order mode during animation.
scalefactor to apply to pivot points, etc. during animation. Subclasses retrieve the value via getScaleFactor().
Indicates whether the animation transformation should be applied before the animation starts. The value of this variable is only relevant if mFillEnabled is true; otherwise it is assumed to be true.
Indicates whether the animation transformation should be applied after the animation ends.
Indicates whether fillBefore should be taken into account.
Creates a new animation with a duration of 0ms, the default interpolator, with fillBefore set to true and fillAfter set to false

memberdef.argsstring: (int width, int height, int parentWidth, int parentHeight)
memberdef.name: initialize

detaileddescription.para: Reset the initialization state of this animation.
Cancel the animation. Cancelling an animation invokes the animation listener, if set, to notify the end of the animation.
If you cancel an animation manually, you must call reset() before starting the animation again.
Sets the acceleration curve for this animation. Defaults to a linear interpolation.

parameterdescription.para: The interpolator which defines the acceleration curve @attr ref android.R.styleable::Animation_interpolator

detaileddescription.para: How long this animation should last. The duration cannot be negative.

durationMillis
Duration in milliseconds
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
if the duration is < 0
@attr ref android.R.styleable::Animation_duration
How much to scale the duration by.

parameterdescription.para: The amount to scale the duration.

detaileddescription.para: If fillEnabled is true, the animation will apply the value of fillBefore. Otherwise, fillBefore is ignored and the animation transformation is always applied until the animation ends.

parameterdescription.para: true if the animation should take the value of fillBefore into account @attr ref android.R.styleable::Animation_fillEnabled

detaileddescription.para: When this animation should start. When the start time is set to START_ON_FIRST_FRAME, the animation will start the first time getTransformation(long, STransformation) is invoked. The time passed to this method should be obtained by calling AnimationUtils#currentAnimationTimeMillis() instead of System#currentTimeMillis().
Convenience method to start the animation the first time getTransformation(long, STransformation) is invoked.
Convenience method to start the animation at the current time in milliseconds.
Defines what this animation should do when it reaches the end. This setting is applied only when the repeat count is either greater than 0 or INFINITE. Defaults to RESTART.

Sets how many times the animation should be repeated. If the repeat count is 0, the animation is never repeated. If the repeat count is greater than 0 or INFINITE, the repeat mode will be taken into account. The repeat count is 0 by default.

parameterdescription.para: the number of times the animation should be repeated @attr ref android.R.styleable::Animation_repeatCount

detaileddescription.para: Set the Z ordering mode to use while running the animation.

parameterdescription.para: The desired mode, one of ZORDER_NORMAL, ZORDER_TOP, or ZORDER_BOTTOM. @attr ref android.R.styleable::Animation_zAdjustment

detaileddescription.para: Gets the acceleration curve type for this animation.

simplesect.para: the Interpolator associated to this animation @attr ref android.R.styleable::Animation_interpolator

detaileddescription.para: When this animation should start. If the animation has not startet yet, this method might return START_ON_FIRST_FRAME.

simplesect.para: the time in milliseconds when the animation should start or START_ON_FIRST_FRAME

detaileddescription.para: How long this animation should last

simplesect.para: the duration in milliseconds of the animation @attr ref android.R.styleable::Animation_duration

detaileddescription.para: When this animation should start, relative to StartTime

simplesect.para: the start offset in milliseconds @attr ref android.R.styleable::Animation_startOffset

detaileddescription.para: Defines what this animation should do when it reaches the end.

simplesect.para: either one of REVERSE or RESTART @attr ref android.R.styleable::Animation_repeatMode

detaileddescription.para: Defines how many times the animation should repeat. The default value is 0.

simplesect.para: the number of times the animation should repeat, or INFINITE @attr ref android.R.styleable::Animation_repeatCount

detaileddescription.para: Returns the Z ordering mode to use while running the animation as previously set by setZAdjustment.

simplesect.para: Returns one of ZORDER_NORMAL, ZORDER_TOP, or ZORDER_BOTTOM. @attr ref android.R.styleable::Animation_zAdjustment

detaileddescription.para: Binds an animation listener to this animation. The animation listener is notified of animation events such as the end of the animation or the repetition of the animation.

parameterdescription.para: the animation listener to be notified

detaileddescription.para: Compute a hint at how long the entire animation may last, in milliseconds. Animations can be written to cause themselves to run for a different duration than what is computed here, but generally this should be accurate.
Gets the transformation to apply at a specified point in time. Implementations of this method should always replace the specified STransformation or document they are doing otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: Where we are in the animation. This is wall clock time.
A transformation object that is provided by the caller and will be filled in by the animation.
Scaling factor to apply to any inputs to the transform operation, such pivot points being rotated or scaled around.

simplesect.para: True if the animation is still running

detaileddescription.para: Gets the transformation to apply at a specified point in time. Implementations of this method should always replace the specified STransformation or document they are doing otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: Where we are in the animation. This is wall clock time.
A transformation object that is provided by the caller and will be filled in by the animation.

simplesect.para: True if the animation is still running

detaileddescription.para: Indicates whether this animation has started or not.

simplesect.para: true if the animation has started, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Indicates whether this animation has ended or not.

simplesect.para: true if the animation has ended, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Return true if this animation changes the view's alpha property.
@hide

Helper for getTransformation. Subclasses should implement this to apply their transforms given an interpolation value. Implementations of this method should always replace the specified STransformation or document they are doing otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: The value of the normalized time (0.0 to 1.0) after it has been run through the interpolation function.
The STransformation object to fill in with the current transforms.

memberdef.argsstring: (ValueType type, float value, int size, int parentSize)
memberdef.name: resolveSize

detaileddescription.para: Convert the information in the description of a size to an actual dimension

parameterdescription.para: One of Animation.ABSOLUTE_VALUE, Animation.RELATIVE_TO_SELF, or Animation.RELATIVE_TO_PARENT.
The dimension associated with the type parameter
The size of the object being animated
The size of the parent of the object being animated

simplesect.para: The dimension to use for the animation

detaileddescription.para: Gurantees that this animation has an interpolator. Will use a AccelerateDecelerateInterpolator is nothing else was specified.

The scale factor is set by the call to getTransformation. Overrides of getTransformation(long, STransformation, float) will get this value directly. Overrides of applyTransformation(float, STransformation) can call this method to get the value.

simplesect.para: float The scale factor that should be applied to pre-scaled values in an Animation such as the pivot points in ScaleAnimation and RotateAnimation.
